(1) The following subsection shall be substituted for subsection (2) of section thirteen of the Dangerous Drugs Act, 1920:-" (2) Every person guilty of an offence against this Act shall be liable -(a) on conviction o^ indictment, to penal servitude for a period not exceeding ten years; or(S) on summary conviction, to a fine not exceeding two hundred and fifty pounds, or to imprison-ment with or without hard labour for a term not exceeding twelve months, or to both such fine and imprisonment [and in the case of a second or subsequent conviction to a fine nut exceeding five hundred pounds, or to imprisonment with or without hard labour for a term not exceeding two years, or to both such fine and imprison-ment];and shall in every case on conviction for the offence forfeit to His Majesty all articles in respect of which the offence was committed, and the court before which the offender was convicted may order any forfeited articles to he destroyed or otherwise disposed of as the court thinks fit."/171-1 Dangerous Drugs (Amendment) Bill.ALTERNATIVE EOB, CLAUSE 2 (1).CLIII.
